sports.definition: A person who competes in one or more sports that require physical strength, speed, or endurance.
The act of scoring in a game by sending a ball or puck into the opposing team's net.
A group of players forming one side in a competitive game.
A person responsible for training and instructing athletes or teams.
The act of winning a game, competition, or battle.
The loss of a game or competition.
A person who has defeated all competitors in a sport or competition.
An event or contest in which individuals or teams compete against each other.
A single contest or game between two teams or individuals.
The number of points or goals achieved in a game.
An official who oversees the rules and fairness of a game.
An action in a game that is against the rules.
A punishment given for committing a foul, often resulting in a free kick or loss of points.
A short break taken during a game to allow rest or strategy discussion.
A period of play in some sports, typically one of four parts of a game.
The ability to endure or sustain prolonged physical or mental effort.
The quality of being physically strong, important in many sports.
The ability to move quickly, crucial in many sports like running and cycling.
The ability to sustain prolonged physical or mental effort, often needed in endurance sports.
To control and move the ball with repeated taps using your feet or hands.
To send the ball to a teammate.
To attempt to score by sending the ball into the goal or basket.
To stop an opponent by using physical force to take the ball away.
A player who replaces another during the game.
An opponent in a competition.
A series of contests in a particular sport or game.
A group of teams or individuals competing against each other in a specific sport.
A specific period during which a sport or competition is played.
An individual who participates in a sport or game.
A player whose primary role is to prevent the opposing team from scoring.
A player whose main role is to score goals in a game.
A player who plays between the defenders and attackers, helping both defense and offense.
A player whose primary responsibility is to protect the goal and prevent the opposing team from scoring.
A pass that leads directly to a goal being scored.
The condition of being physically healthy and strong, often important for athletes.
Exercises performed before a game or activity to prepare the body.
Light exercise after a workout or game to reduce muscle soreness.
A person who watches a game or event but does not participate.
The location where a sports event takes place.
The best performance or achievement in a particular sport or event.
The best performance an athlete has achieved in their career.
Physical harm or damage sustained during a sport.
Medical care given to an injured player.
The process of regaining strength or health after injury or exertion.
An assessment used to measure an athlete's physical abilities.
Low-intensity exercises done before engaging in physical activity to prevent injury.
The act of extending muscles to increase flexibility before or after exercise.
The day on which a scheduled sports event or game takes place.
A book or collection of strategies and tactics used by a team or coach.
